page.title: 20BUILDINGS IN BURWELL AREA.
page.content: Many of the oldest buildings such as {Hall Farm}in Swaffham Prior's North Fen have{clunch (locally quarried {upper chalk)}and timber framed walls. The{oldest house in Burwell,}on the corner of Isaacson Rd, has walls made of clunch and some later brick.It has an attic and a cellar.It was probably built in the 14th century . Opposite it the{old Maltings}are now being repaired and re-thatched by new owners. The clunch was probably obtained from the pits behind Isaacson Rd.A newer material is{Burwell 'white' brick which used to be made here till quite recently. {ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS. {These pages were produced by Class 7 {Log Burwell Village College and their {teacher Mr.R.Logan. Thanks are due to {all who assisted in so many ways.
